intro: Diplotaxis virgata f. brevisiliqua, commonly known as the short-stemmed synedrella, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are short and compact. This variety is notable for its unique morphology and is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its delicate appearance.
